text: Hi, I’m new to HubSpot. I build a theme from scratch for the practicum, but I’m stumped on the team module build. The directions are a bit vague and I don’t recall seeing how to do this in the Academy videos. It says to use ‘repeating groups of fields to allow editors to add and subtract team members’. Is there a group field? Do I wrap it with a choice field to allow for add / subtract? I have a 3 column module already built, but not sure how to make it so that an editor can do this. Also, it asks to make the layout change to 2 columns on screens below 900. I’m using flexbox for layout and can see how to get it down to 1 column on mobile devices using flex-direction, but not sure how to get it to 2 columns. Flex already shrinks and grows with the browser. Can someone point me in the right direction?

Hi Al. I created a video awhile back that goes through creating a module with repeated fields. You need to group fields together. THEN you click a checkbox to make those fields repeat as separate items.

<https://youtu.be/Sg6l7579Qb8?t=479>

One of the other requirements is for the header to have an editable quote. The default header partial doesn’t allow for editing. I see “You don’t have access to edit global content.” How do you make it so that the header can be edited?
<@UG7S8J18D> Bro, I’ve been watching your videos! Thanks! I’ll check it out.
try editing your page and hover over the header. Then click and edit the global header. The header then has drag and drop areas you can add modules. Try creating a quote module and dropping in there.
Another requirement is to ‘have at least 2 theme fields to control the font and the accent color used in the header and footer’ Do I add those to my CSS file? Or somewhere in my template file?
This is what I see in my header Jake
did you create your HubSpot account?
This is my header code
or are you an employee with another company?
I’m using a Sandbox account that my employee gave.
you may need higher user permissions to allow you to edit global content
can they make you super admin on that sandbox?
OK, I’ll ask for that, thanks
sure... and just something to keep in mind. I am not sure how easy it is to transfer certifications away from a company
Got it. Good to know.
I always did my certificates on my personal email and sandbox. That way, I own that proof and is transferable
You can get your own sandbox?
indeed you can
With those admin rights?
I do have a personal HubSpot account
<https://offers.HubSpot.com/free-cms-developer-sandbox>
but a free personal account should be good because you are the super admin
you will have the free badge in the left hand corner but you can use to pass the cerficiation. I would do certifications off that vs the developer sandbox accounts
that way everything is tied to your personal email
Nice
And I probably can move my theme there

congratulations on what you are doing. I know it is a lot at first to go through the hoops. But it will be worth it. I used to do a lot of Wordpress themes and working with HubSpot becomes fun. It is a simpler way of doing things
that will be good practice also to move a theme with the cli

checkout the field.json - best way to do this is find an existing field and copy and paste it and follow suite. Then look at the theme_overrides.css and see how that works to reference the theme colors.
<https://github.com/HubSpot/cms-theme-boilerplate/blob/main/src/css/theme-overrides.css#L72>
Super helpful! Thanks!
FYI Certifications are really easy to transfer now, can be done from your portal directly and if you do lose access, the academy team in the community can help transfer for you
